snippet: Some thought the closure of the Chase Manhattan Plaza last September was prompted by the Occupy Wall Street protests, and organizers’ plans to meet there.
abstract: Chase Manhattan Plaza in Lower Manhattan has been closed since September, prompting many to wonder if owner JPMorgan Chase made the move to prevent further Occupy Wall Street protests on the public site; lawsuit is filed against the New York City Department of Buildings over a refusal to disclose renovation plans for the plaza, challenging city's assertion that plans must remain secret due to terrorism concerns.
lead_paragraph: Some thought the closure of the Chase Manhattan Plaza last September was prompted by the Occupy Wall Street protests, and organizers’ plans to meet there.

headline.seo: Fenced-In Chase Manhattan Plaza Is Subject of Lawsuit
headline.main: Suit Seeks Plans for Closed Public Plaza as Owner’s Motives Are Questioned
headline.print_headline: Suit Seeks Plans for Closed Public Plaza as Owner’s Motives Are Questioned
